intro: Calydorea minuana, commonly known as the dwarf calydorea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
